intro: Glaucium yazdianum, commonly known as the Yazd poppy, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Iran. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family, which includes other well-known species like the opium poppy. The plant is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in mountainous areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
